tweets.text: More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. tweets.text: Radio 4 now - @CleanIlkley and @sascampaigns highlighting the dumping of sewage into our rivers and the lack of @EnvAgency regulation of the existing legislation... the familiar story of 'help is on the way', but the numbers (five years to drop from 123days/yr to 95) ain't great.
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids So a spot check finds 6 loads when they make the effort that 42 a week. So 2184 a year and you wonder why we suffer.
6 loads! what was happening before the @EnvAgencyMids made you check every load! https://t.co/08NjiPSfYN

@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @MoretonBack1 @Jennifer_Hil1 I‚Äôm very much looking forward to the enforcement team coming down to the Sunbury to Teddington stretch. I do sometimes wonder why I pay river licence and safety certificate!!

@SOPH_C_ So before now absolutely no loads were turned away? So it is only now operators are trying to dump loads not allowed? It seems odd people would only try now with such attention on the site. Is there an audit trail for ALL historical checks? @EnvAgency #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe
Not fit for purpose @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids Wake Up and smell the ü§¨‚ò†ü§Æü§ßü•µ‚ò£ #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/RANSLWjTKJ

What a fabulous first for TEP!üíô

We just hosted our very first #EstuaryEdges Webinar. Chaired by TEP Technical Director, Amy Pryor, we heard from Richard Charman, Steve Colclough and Heather Hilburn.
Keep an eye out for the link to register for the second webinar‚Ä¶ coming soon! https://t.co/Wccimg7okt

Nice to catch up with this pair of swans yesterday, released recently after their treatment here at the Sanctuary for fuel contamination, leaked from a vehicle entering the water. They were returned to their territory following a successful clean up of the waterway by @EnvAgency https://t.co/cuqQujDY7d

There will be records of whether loads are usually turned away or not & the @EnvAgency can ask to see them but something tells me they don‚Äôt want to dig because they can‚Äôt afford what they might find @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/nFSiK3Is3L

So tonight Walley is taking a 3.5 mile hike to plague the poor folks of Halmerend. @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @PHE_uk @MattHancock @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @StinkStopthe 
#plague https://t.co/CwBralrlcr

tweets.text: How drastic is it when you are Tweeting in the middle of the night! They must be releasing gas from the wells at Mullaghglass landfill! Just moved into the spare bedroom, window closed, purifier on, sniffing a Vicks stick! ü§¢@Mullaghglass123 @daera_ni @edwinpootsmla
Heavy pollution on the R. Nene from Brackmills Ind. Est. Northampton this morning. @ChronandEcho @BBCNorthampton @NorthamptonBC https://t.co/bBjVJAzUyi

We can't believe this. 

üò° People are still taking BBQs to our moorland. 

Less than 3 weeks ago, our crews spent days tackling a devasting fire on Marsden Moor.

‚ùåBBQs are BANNED on our moorland. ‚ùå
If you see somebody with one, dial 999. 

#BeMoorAware.
@WestYorksPolice https://t.co/uYGdxKfFw9
@annjsmall @StinkStopthe @HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @Cap_it_off @EnvAgency Silverdale horrendous stench all last night.

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA Monitoring fine, but residents do that for them with their nightly calls to EA operators, my fear is monitoring is @ClareDinnisEA stalling til 2026, they know we are being poisoned, if they know they will never #stopthestink it has to close & now.

@EllieChowns @EnvAgency We agree absolutely Ellie. This is wrong. Why then has @HfdsCouncil dug it‚Äôs heels in and refused to concede this case which is about the contamination of the Wye catchment & the powers of councils to protect river systems? 

https://t.co/TL708MSWrH

@SimonLennane @GValleyAG2 @EnvAgency @timthefruit @EMorfett @HelenStace_HWT I know of a house developer who digs a trench so the muddy surface water off their site can run off onto the roads.  Yet a farmer has planted potatoes in such a way it captures  surface water before it hits the road. Don't always blame the farmer!

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG
@EllieChowns @EnvAgency @EnvAgency what are you doing about this??

Waterways and navigation enforcement patrol out at #Maidenhead today ,30 vessels checked for River licences and 18 booked for being unregistered .‚Å¶@EnvAgencySE‚Å© ‚Å¶@MarkHill03‚Å© ‚Å¶@MoretonBack1‚Å© ‚Å¶@Jennifer_Hil1‚Å© https://t.co/Xr4cqAOffe

There are many farmers who do a brilliant job of caring for the land.  But sadly not all, as the incidents I've recently reported show. The @NFUtweets and others need to help ensure all farmers stick to the rules to keep our rivers clean.

Breaking News . @EnvAgency have sanctioned the destruction of breeding birds tomorrow at the Lower Otter Restoration Project . This is #HS2 part 2 . PLEASE THINK AGAIN @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest Please follow @WiseBirding and RT https://t.co/I8Wv40YKqy
People in Newcastle under Lyme can't even grieve in piece @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA You people make me sick. https://t.co/fCDcK2obsq

tweets.text: @HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency A rare Friday night when we hopefully will all sleep, hope you have clean air tonight, & get a good rest. We certainly appreciate the simple things that most of UK take for granted, #stopthestink

@poppers82 @SianieRoo @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock @HelenVi00175623 A rare night off so far but not sure it will last, yes we keep reporting, keep highlighting reality of life in Newcastle u Lyme & people are starting to listen, together we will get fresh clean air for our kids, & community. #stopthestink

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP
